verses.roman:
deha-tyāgaś ca rājarṣer
viṣṇu-rātasya dhīmataḥ
śākhā-praṇayanam ṛṣer
mārkaṇḍeyasya sat-kathā
mahā-puruṣa-vinyāsaḥ
sūryasya jagad-ātmanaḥ

synonyms: deha-tyāgaḥ—the relinquishing of his body; ca—and; rāja-ṛṣeḥ—by the saintly king; viṣṇu-rātasya—Parīkṣit; dhī-mataḥ—the intelligent; śākhā—of the branches of the Vedas; praṇayanam—the dissemination; ṛṣeḥ—from the great sage Vyāsadeva; mārkaṇḍeyasya—of Mārkaṇḍeya Ṛṣi; sat-kathā—the pious narration; mahā-puruṣa—of the universal form of the Lord; vinyāsaḥ—the detailed arrangement; sūryasya—of the sun; jagat-ātmanaḥ—who is the soul of the universe.
translation: There are also an account of the passing away of the wise and saintly King Viṣṇurāta [Parīkṣit], an explanation of how Śrīla Vyāsadeva disseminated the branches of the Vedas, a pious narration concerning Mārkaṇḍeya Ṛṣi, and a description of the detailed arrangement of the Lord's universal form and His form as the sun, the soul of the universe.
